name: Emily Teed
body: JANUARY 11, 2024 2024-1 Under subsections 3(1) and 3(2) of the New Brunswick Museum Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Emily Teed of Saint John, New Brunswick, as a member, and appoints her as President, of the Board of the New Brunswick Museum, effective January 11, 2024, for a term of i” three years. oBrendma L. e Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the. _ Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil. name: Peter Smith
position: Member of the Board of Directors
body: JANUARY 11, 2024 Under paragraph 3(1)(b) and subsection 3(2) of the Atlantic Provinces Special Education Authority Agreement, the Lieutenant-Governor ; in Council reappoints Peter Smith of Saint John, New Brunswick, as a - member of the Board of Directors of the Atlantic Special Education. Authority, effective January 11, 2024, for a term of two years. Brenda L. name: Andrée Poitras
body: 14 JANUARY 25, 2024 1. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1)(a) and subsection 21(4) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council reappoints Johanne Thériault-Paulin of Bathurst, New Brunswick, as Chair of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 2. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1)(b) and subsection 21(4) of the New Brunswick Regulation 2008-4, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council reappoints Bert Cyr of Dieppe, New Brunswick, as a Vice-Chair of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification, representing the English language, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 3. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1)(b) and subsection 21(4) of the New Brunswick Regulation 2008-4, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council reappoints Andrée Poitras of Grand Falls, New Brunswick, as a Vice-Chair of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification, representing the French language, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 4, Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1})(c) and subsection 21(4) of the New Brunswick 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Chery! Richardson of Miramichi, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board of Teacher Certification, to represent anglophone teachers, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 14 5. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1)(c) and subsection 21(4) of the New Brunswick 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Ellen Culbert of Woodstock, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board of Teacher Certification, to represent anglophone teachers, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 6. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1)(c) and subsection 21(4) of the New Brunswick 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant-Governor -in Council reappoints Laurie LaForge of Grand Falls, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board of Teacher Certification, to represent anglophone teachers, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 7. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1)(d) and subsection 21(4) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Héléne Savoie Chouinard of Kedgwick, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification, to - represent francophone teachers, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 8. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1)(d) and subsection 21(4) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Marie-Claude Imough of Beresford, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification, to represent francophone teachers, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 14 9. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1)(d) and subsection 21(4) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Sylvie Lavoie of Miramichi, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification, to represent francophone teachers, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 10. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and subsections 21(2), 21(4) and paragraph 21(1)(e) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council reappoints Thomas Geburt of Oromocto, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification to represent the public, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 11. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and subsections 21(1) and 21(4), and paragraph 21(1)(e) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004- 8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Andy Flanagan of Miramichi, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification to répresent the public, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 12. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and subsections 21(1) and 21(4), and paragraph 21(1)(e) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004- 8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Roger Nesbitt of Quispamsis, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification to represent the public, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. -4- 14 13. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and subsections 21(3) and 21(4), and paragraph 21(1)(f) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004- 8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Steeve Savoie of Kedgwick, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification to represent the public, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 14. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and subsections 21(3) and 21(4), and paragraph 21(1)(f) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004- 8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Michel Cété of Rothesay, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification to represent the public, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 15. Under section 31(1) of the Education Act, and subsections 21(3) and 21(4), and paragraph 21(1)(f) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Michéle Hébert of Caraquet, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification to represent the public, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. name: Cade Libby
position: Deputy Minister of Natural Resources and Energy Development
body: 18 JANUARY 25, 2024 2024-18 1. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Cade Libby as Deputy Minister of Natural Resources and Energy Development, effective January 29, 2024. 2. Under subsection 3(1) of the Regional Development Corporation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Joel Dickinson as President of the Regional Development Corporation, effective January 29, 2024. 3. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act and section 27 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council amends Order in Council 2023-132 dated June 15, 2023 by removing the word “Acting” where it appears therein, effective January 29, 2024. 4, Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act and sections 26 and 27 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2023-210 dated October 5, 2023. Aut Brenda L. Rha. Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 25 January 2024. Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire du Cabinet

name: Chantal LaFleur
body: 13 JANUARY 25, 2024 1. Under subsection 8(1.02) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council receives a description of the skills and qualifications required of the Board of Directors of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission as a whole for the board to carry out its functions, and the skills and qualifications required for the position to be filled. 2. Under paragraph 8(1.03)(e) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council receives a description of the recruitment, assessment and selection process used and the result of those processes. 3. Under paragraphs 8(1)(b) and 8(1.03)(a) and subsections 9(2) and 9(5) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Michael MacMullin of Saint John, New Brunswick, as a member representing workers on the Board of Directors of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 4. Under paragraphs 8(1)(b) and 8(1.03)(a) and subsection 9(2) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Chantal LaFleur of Edmundston, New Brunswick, as a member representing workers on the Board of Directors of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of five years. -2- 13 5. Under paragraphs 8(1)(c) and 8(1.03){b) and subsection 9(2) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Gaétan Guérette of Edmundston, New Brunswick, as a member representing employers on the Board of Directors of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of five years. De Mmpry Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 25 January 2024. Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire du Cabinet

name: Ellen Culbert
body: 14 JANUARY 25, 2024 1. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1)(a) and subsection 21(4) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council reappoints Johanne Thériault-Paulin of Bathurst, New Brunswick, as Chair of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 2. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1)(b) and subsection 21(4) of the New Brunswick Regulation 2008-4, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council reappoints Bert Cyr of Dieppe, New Brunswick, as a Vice-Chair of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification, representing the English language, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 3. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1)(b) and subsection 21(4) of the New Brunswick Regulation 2008-4, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council reappoints Andrée Poitras of Grand Falls, New Brunswick, as a Vice-Chair of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification, representing the French language, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 4, Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1})(c) and subsection 21(4) of the New Brunswick 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Chery! Richardson of Miramichi, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board of Teacher Certification, to represent anglophone teachers, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 14 5. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1)(c) and subsection 21(4) of the New Brunswick 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Ellen Culbert of Woodstock, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board of Teacher Certification, to represent anglophone teachers, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 6. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1)(c) and subsection 21(4) of the New Brunswick 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant-Governor -in Council reappoints Laurie LaForge of Grand Falls, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board of Teacher Certification, to represent anglophone teachers, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 7. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1)(d) and subsection 21(4) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Héléne Savoie Chouinard of Kedgwick, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification, to - represent francophone teachers, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 8. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1)(d) and subsection 21(4) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Marie-Claude Imough of Beresford, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification, to represent francophone teachers, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 14 9. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and paragraph 21(1)(d) and subsection 21(4) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Sylvie Lavoie of Miramichi, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification, to represent francophone teachers, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 10. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and subsections 21(2), 21(4) and paragraph 21(1)(e) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council reappoints Thomas Geburt of Oromocto, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification to represent the public, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 11. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and subsections 21(1) and 21(4), and paragraph 21(1)(e) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004- 8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Andy Flanagan of Miramichi, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification to répresent the public, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 12. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and subsections 21(1) and 21(4), and paragraph 21(1)(e) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004- 8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Roger Nesbitt of Quispamsis, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification to represent the public, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. -4- 14 13. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and subsections 21(3) and 21(4), and paragraph 21(1)(f) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004- 8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Steeve Savoie of Kedgwick, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification to represent the public, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 14. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act, and subsections 21(3) and 21(4), and paragraph 21(1)(f) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004- 8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Michel Cété of Rothesay, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification to represent the public, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 15. Under section 31(1) of the Education Act, and subsections 21(3) and 21(4), and paragraph 21(1)(f) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Michéle Hébert of Caraquet, New Brunswick, as a member of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification to represent the public, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. Brenda L. - ersy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 25 Janua ry 2024. y Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire du Cabinet

name: Gaétan Guérette
body: 13 JANUARY 25, 2024 1. Under subsection 8(1.02) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council receives a description of the skills and qualifications required of the Board of Directors of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission as a whole for the board to carry out its functions, and the skills and qualifications required for the position to be filled. 2. Under paragraph 8(1.03)(e) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council receives a description of the recruitment, assessment and selection process used and the result of those processes. 3. Under paragraphs 8(1)(b) and 8(1.03)(a) and subsections 9(2) and 9(5) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Michael MacMullin of Saint John, New Brunswick, as a member representing workers on the Board of Directors of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 4. Under paragraphs 8(1)(b) and 8(1.03)(a) and subsection 9(2) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Chantal LaFleur of Edmundston, New Brunswick, as a member representing workers on the Board of Directors of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of five years. -2- 13 5. Under paragraphs 8(1)(c) and 8(1.03){b) and subsection 9(2) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Gaétan Guérette of Edmundston, New Brunswick, as a member representing employers on the Board of Directors of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of five years. De Mmpry Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 25 January 2024. Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire du Cabinet

name: Joel Dickinson
body: 18 JANUARY 25, 2024 2024-18 1. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Cade Libby as Deputy Minister of Natural Resources and Energy Development, effective January 29, 2024. 2. Under subsection 3(1) of the Regional Development Corporation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Joel Dickinson as President of the Regional Development Corporation, effective January 29, 2024. 3. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act and section 27 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council amends Order in Council 2023-132 dated June 15, 2023 by removing the word “Acting” where it appears therein, effective January 29, 2024. 4, Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act and sections 26 and 27 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2023-210 dated October 5, 2023. Aut Brenda L. Rha. Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 25 January 2024. Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire du Cabinet

name: Michael MacMullin
body: 13 JANUARY 25, 2024 1. Under subsection 8(1.02) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council receives a description of the skills and qualifications required of the Board of Directors of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission as a whole for the board to carry out its functions, and the skills and qualifications required for the position to be filled. 2. Under paragraph 8(1.03)(e) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council receives a description of the recruitment, assessment and selection process used and the result of those processes. 3. Under paragraphs 8(1)(b) and 8(1.03)(a) and subsections 9(2) and 9(5) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Michael MacMullin of Saint John, New Brunswick, as a member representing workers on the Board of Directors of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of three years. 4. Under paragraphs 8(1)(b) and 8(1.03)(a) and subsection 9(2) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Chantal LaFleur of Edmundston, New Brunswick, as a member representing workers on the Board of Directors of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of five years. -2- 13 5. Under paragraphs 8(1)(c) and 8(1.03){b) and subsection 9(2) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Gaétan Guérette of Edmundston, New Brunswick, as a member representing employers on the Board of Directors of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission, effective January 25, 2024, for a term of five years. De Mmpry Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 25 January 2024. Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire du Cabinet

name: Stephen Manuel
body: 32 FEBRUARY 15, 2024 1. Under paragraph 31(1)(e) and subsection 32(1) of the Control of Municipalities Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council declares that the Municipality of Lakeland Ridges is subject to the prov isions of Part V of the Control of Municipalities Act. 2. Under subsections 32(1) and 33(1) of the Control of Municipalities Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Stephen Manuel of Ritchie, New Brunswick, as the Supervisor of the Municipality of Lakeland Ridges and vests in the Supervisor control and charge over the administration of all of the affairs of the local government, and all of those powers conferred upon a Supervisor pursuant to Pajt V of the Control of Municipalities Act, effective February 16, 2024. 3. Under section 44 of the Control of M lunicipalities Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council gives approval to Stephen Manuel, Supervisor of the Municipality of Lakeland Ridges, to take full charge and control over all money belonging to the Municipality of Lakeland Ridges and received by any person for or on its behalf, and to sign all cheques drawn and issued by the Municipality of Lakeland Ridges and to authorize a person to countersign such cheques. 32 5. Under paragraph 31(1)(e), subsections 32(1) and 33(1), and sections 34, 38 and 44 of the Control of Municipalities Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2023-193 dated September 13, 2023, effective|February 16, 2024. As. Under subsections 3(1) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Jan Rademaker of Grand Falls, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, effective February 29, 2024, for a term of three years. 2. Under subsections 3(1) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Brian McCullum of Pearsonville, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, effective February 29, 2024, for a term of three years. 3. Under subsections 3(1) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Bev Bacon of Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, effective Februar29y, 2024, for a term of three years. 4. Under subsections 3(1) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Benson Milner of Pointe-du-Chéne, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, effective February 29, 2024, for a term of three years. 5. Under subsections 3(1), 3({2) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Cathy LaRochelle of Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, and designates her as Chair, effective February 29, 2024, for a term of three years. name: Andrea Draper-Calhoun
position: Administrator of the Court of King’s Bench — Family Division, Clerk of the Court of King’s Bench - Trial Division, Clerk of the Probate Court
body: 49 MARCH 12, 2024 1. Under subsection 68(1) of the Judicature Act, and subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Pamela Bourque of Rothesay, New Brunswick, as a Clerk of the Court of King’s Bench ~— Trial Division, and Clerk of the Probate Court of New Brunswick, for the Judicial District of Saint John, effective March 12, 2024. 2. Under subsection 68(1) of the Judicature Act, and subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Sarah Hébert of Steeves Mountain, New Brunswick, as a Clerk of the Court of King’s Bench - Trial Division, and Clerk of the Probate Court of New Brunswick, for the Judicial District of Moncton, effective March 12, 2024. 3. Under subsection 68(2) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Lindsay Genier of Grand-Bay Westfield, New Brunswick, as an Administrator of the Court of King’s Bench — Family Division, for the Judicial District of Saint John, effective March 12, 2024. 4, Under subsection 68(2) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Chantal Simpson of Riverview, New Brunswick, as an Administrator of the Court of King’s Bench — Family Division, for the Judicial District of Moncton, effective March 12, 2024. 5. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, and subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Mandy Guay of Oromocto, New Brunswick, as an Administrator of the Court of King’s Bench — Family Division, a Clerk of the Court of King’s Bench - Trial Division, and a Clerk of the Probate Court of New Brunswick, for the Judicial District of Fredericton, effective March 12, 2024. -2- 6. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, and subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Stephene Baglole of Miramichi, New Brunswick, as an Administrator of the Court of King’s Bench — Family Division, a Clerk of the Court of King’s Bench - Trial Division, and a Clerk of the Probate Court of New Brunswick, for the Judicial District of Miramichi, effective March 12, 2024. 7. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, and subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Johanne Gray-Godin of Bathurst, New Brunswick, as an Administrator of the Court of King’s Bench — Family Division, a Clerk of the Court of King’s Bench — Trial Division, and a Clerk of the Probate Court of New Brunswick, for the Judicial District of Bathurst, effective March 12, 2024. 8. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, and subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Andrea Draper-Calhoun of Bedell, New Brunswick, as an Administrator of the Court of King’s Bench — Family Division, a Clerk of the Court of King’s Bench - Trial Division, and a Clerk of the Probate Court of New Brunswick, for the Judicial District of Woodstock, effective March 12, 2024. 9. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes sections 1 and 3 of Order in Council 95-1070 dated November 23, 1995. 10. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes paragraph (a) of Order in Council 2002-101 dated March 14, 2002. 11. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Sections 2 and 3 of Order in Council 2012-266 dated August 14, 2012. 12. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2013-94 dated March 20, 2013. 13. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2003-107 dated April 17, 2003. 14. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes sections 4, 6, and 8 of Order in Council 2018-369 dated December 5, 2018. 15. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes sections 2, 3, and 4 of Order in Council 2023-137 dated June 22, 2023. Ax Brenda L. name: Michel C. Leger
body: 58 MARCH 21, 2024 1. Under paragraph 2(1)(a) and subsection 3(1) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Michel C. Leger of Dieppe, New Brunswick, as Chair of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, effective May 6, 2024, for a term of seven years. 2. Under paragraph 58(1)(a) and subsection 60(1) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Michel C. Leger of Dieppe, New Brunswick, as Chair of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Tribunal, effective May 6, 2024, for a term of seven years. 3. Under subsection 4(1) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council determines remuneration to be paid to the Chair of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board in accordance with Step D, Level | of the Deputy Minister Pay Plan, effective May 6, 2024. 4, Under section 61 of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council determines remuneration to be paid to the Chair of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Tribunal in accordance with Step D, Level | of the Deputy Minister Pay Plan, effective May 6, 2024. 5. Under section 61 of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council fixes the rate of reimbursement of expenses incurred by the Chair while acting on behalf of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Tribunal in accordance with the Senior Executive Travel Directive of the Treasury Board, effective May 6, 2024. 58 6. Under paragraph 5(1)(a) and subsection 5(2) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Giselle Goguen of Fredericton, New Brunswick, effective April 1, 2024, for a term of seven years. 7. Under section 8 of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council determines the remuneration to be paid to the Chair of the Local Governance Commission in accordance with Step D, Level | of the Deputy Minister Pay Plan, and fixes the rate for reimbursement of expenses incurred by the Chair while acting on behalf of the Commission in accordance with the Senior Executive Travel Directive of the Treasury Board, effective April 1, 2024. 8. Under paragraph 2(1)(a) and subsection 3(1) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2024-44 dated February 29, 2024. 9. Under paragraph 5(1)(a) and subsection 5(2) of the Local Governance Commission Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2024-45 dated February 29, 2024. 10. Under subsection 4(1) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes section 2 of Order in Council 2001-504 dated November 2, 2001. name: Beth Hatt
body: 67 MARCH 28, 2024 1. Under subsection 3{2), 3(3) and 3(4) of New Brunswick Regulation 95-122, the General Regulation under the Agricultural Insurance Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Gailen Allan of Glassville, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Agricultural Insurance Commission, and appoints him as Chairperson, effective April 22, 2024, for a term of three years. 2. Under subsection 3(2), 3(3) and 3(4) of New Brunswick Regulation 95-122, the General Regulation under the Agricultural Insurance Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Beth Hatt of St. George, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Agricultural Insurance Commission, and appoints her as Vice-Chairperson, effective April 22, 2024, for a term of three years. 3. Under subsection 3(2), 3(3) and 3(4) of New Brunswick Regulation 95-122, the General Regulation under the Agricultural Insurance Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints David DuPlessis of Douglas, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Agricultural Insurance Commission, effective April 22, 2024, for a term of two years. 4, Under subsection 3(2), 3(3) and 3(4) of New Brunswick Regulation 95-122, the General Regulation under the Agricultural Insurance Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Jan Rademaker of Grand Falls, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Agricultural Insurance Commission, effective April 22, 2024, for a term of two years. -2- 67 5. Under subsection 3(2), 3(3) and 3(4) of New Brunswick Regulation 95-122, the General Regulation under the Agricultural Insurance Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Jean-Marie Pelletier of Drummond, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Agricultural Insurance Commission, effective April 22, 2024, for a term of two years. 6. Under subsection 3(2), 3(3) and 3(4) of New Brunswick Regulation 95-122, the General Regulation under the Agricultural Insurance Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Gilles Godbout of Grand Falls, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Agricultural Insurance Commission, effective April 22, 2024, for a term of two years. name: The Hon. Judge Anne-Marie Jacques
body: 69 MARCH 28, 2024 2024-69 Under subsection 4.5(1) of the Provincial Court Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the Hon. Judge Anne-Marie Jacques of the Cour du Québec or, in her absence, illness or if she is unable to preside, another judge of the Cour du Québec, to preside over the matter of R v Serge René Guitard before the Provincial Court of New Brunswick, where: Serge René Guitard, between December 31, 2023 and January 4, 2024, both dates included, at or near Saint-Quentin, New Brunswick, a) did knowingly utter a threat to Luc Roy to cause death or bodily harm to him, thereby committing an indictable offence, contrary to paragraph 264.1(1)(a) and in violation of paragraph 264.1(2)(a) of the Criminal Code and amendments thereto; b = did knowingly cause Basile Chiasson to receive a threat to cause death or bodily harm to Luc Roy, thereby committing an indictable offence, contrary to paragraph 264.1(1)(a) and in violation of paragraph 264.1(2)(a) of the Criminal Code and amendments thereto; c) did, without lawful authority, engage in any conduct with the intention to provoke a state of fear in Luc Roy and Judge Suzanne Bernard, a justice system participant, in order to impede them in the performance of their duties, committing thereby an indictable offence, contrary to and in violation of paragraph 423.1(1)(b) of the Criminal Code and amendments thereto; -2- 69 d) while bound by a probation order made by a Provincial Court Judge on July 27, 2023, did fail, without reasonable excuse, to comply with a condition of that order, namely: “N’avoir aucun contact directement ou indirectement, avec Suzanne Bernard, Pierre Roussel et Marie- Philip Dumont et ne pas se rendre a sa/leurs résidence(s) ou lieu(x) d’emploi ” thereby committing an indictable offence, contrary to and in violation of paragraph 733.1(1}(a) of the Criminal Code and amendments thereto; e) while bound by a probation order made by a Provincial Court Judge on June 9, 2022, did fail, without reasonable excuse, to comply with a condition of that order, namely: “Vous ne devez pas communiquer, directement ou indirectement, avec Pierre Roussel et Suzanne Bernard et ne pas se rendre a sa/leurs résidence(s) ou lieu(x) de travail” thereby committing an indictable offence, contrary to and in violation of paragraph 733.1(1)(a) of the Criminal Code and amendments thereto; f) while bound by a probation order made by a Provincial Court Judge on October 8, 2021, did fail, without reasonable excuse, to comply with a condition of that order, namely: “S’abstenir de communiquer, directement ou indirectement, avec Suzanne Bernard, Pierre Roussel, c.r., Luc Roy, Shawn Beaulieu, Vanessa Nadeau, Maryléne Pilote, René Labbé, Eric Cormier” thereby committing an indictable offence, contrary to and in violation of paragraph 733.1(1)(a) of the Criminal Code and amendments thereto; -3- 69 g) while bound by a probation order made by a Provincial Court Judge on July 27, 2023, did fail, without reasonable excuse, to comply with a condition of that order, namely: “N’avoir aucun contact directement ou indirectement, avec Suzanne Bernard, Pierre Roussel et Marie- Philip Dumont et ne pas se rendre a sa/leurs résidence(s) ou lieu(x) d’emploi” thereby committing an indictable offence, contrary to and in violation of paragraph 733.1(1)(a) of the Criminal Code and amendments thereto; and h while bound by a probation order made by a Provincial Court Judge = on July 27, 2023, did fail, without reasonable excuse, to comply with a condition of that order, namely: “Shall keep the peace and be of good behaviour” thereby committing an indictable offence, contrary to and in violation of paragraph 733.1(1)(a) of the Criminal Code and amendments thereto. Brenda L. at tD Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 28 March 2024. Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire du Cabinet

name: Andrew McLaughlin
body: 81 APRIL 4, 2024 2024-81 1. Under subsection 8(5) of the Opportunities New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council acknowledges receipt ofa description of the skills and qualifications required of the Board of Directors of Opportunities New Brunswick as a whole in order for the Board of Directors of Opportunities New Brunswick to carry out its functions, and the skills and qualifications required of nominees for the Board positions to be filled. 2. Under paragraph 8(6)(c) of the Opportunities New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council acknowledges receipt of a description of the recruitment, assessment and selection processes and the results of those processes. 3. Under paragraph 8(1)(c) and subsections 8(3) and 9(1) of the Opportunities New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Natasha Ostaff of Moncton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Directors of Opportunities New Brunswick, effective April 4, 2024, for a term of three years. 4. Under paragraph 8(1)(c) and subsections 8(3) and 9(1) of the Opportunities New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Tom Liston of Toronto, Ontario, as a member of the Board of Directors of Opportunities New Brunswick, effective April 4, 2024, for a term of two years. 81 5. Under section 10 of the Opportunities New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Barry Kyle of Bathurst, New Brunswick, as Chairperson of the Board of Directors of Opportunities New Brunswick, effective April 4, 2024, for a term ending August 25, 2025. 6. Under section 10 of the Opportunities New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Andrew McLaughlin, New Brunswick, as Vice-Chairperson of the Board of Directors of Opportunities New Brunswick, effective April 4, 2024, for a term ending December 6, 2026. Under subsections 18(1) and 18(2) of the Police Act, and paragraph 21(1)(b) of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Brian Malone of Saint John, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Police Commission, designated as a part- time member, effective September 7, 2024, for a term of three years. 2. Under subsections 18(1) and 18(2) of the Police Act, and paragraph 21(1)(b) of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Lynn Chaplin of Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Police Commission, designated as a part- time member, effective October 7, 2024, for a term of one year. 3. Under subsections 18(1) and 18(2) of the Police Act, and paragraph 21(1)(b) of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Sandy Ward of Dieppe, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Police Commission, designated as a part-time member, effective September 7, 2024, for a term ending October 6, 2027. 4. Under subsections 18(1) and 18(2) of the Police Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Sandy Ward of Dieppe, New Brunswick, as Vice-Chairperson of the New Brunswick Police Commission, and designates her as a part-time member, effective October 7, 2024, for a term of three years. name: Donna Redmond Gates
body: 82 APRIL 4, 2024 1. Under paragraph 5(1)(b).and subsection 5(3) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Jacques Dubé of Bathurst, New Brunswick, as a member and Vice- Chairperson of the Local Governance Commission, effective April 4, 2024, for a term of three years. 2.0 Under paragraph 5(1)(b) and subsection. 5(3) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Troy Stone of Bath, New Brunswick, as a member of the Local Governance Commission, effective April 4, 2024, for a term of five years. 3. Under paragraph 5(1)(b) and subsection 5(3) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints John Nugent of Saint John, New Brunswick, as a member of the Local Governance Commission, effective April 4, 2024, for a term of five years. 4. Under paragraph 5(1})(b) and subsection 5{3) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Donna Redmond Gates of Quispamsis, New Brunswick, as a member of the Local Governance Commission, effective April 4, 2024, for a term of three years. -2- 82 5. Under section 8 of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council determines the remuneration for the Vice- Chairperson and members of the Local Governance Commission as follows: a) $200 for a day of four hours or more; b) $100 for a day of less than four hours; and c) $400 for a day when the Vice-Chairperson acts in absence of the Chairperson; or d) $200 for a day of less than four hours when the Vice-Chairperson acts in absence of the Chairperson. 6. Under section 8 of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council fixes the rate for reimbursement of expenses incurred by the Vice-Chairperson and members of the Local Governance Commission while acting on behalf of the Commission in accordance with Government of New Brunswick Administration Manual Policy AD-2801. Brenda L. name: John Nugent
body: 82 APRIL 4, 2024 1. Under paragraph 5(1)(b).and subsection 5(3) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Jacques Dubé of Bathurst, New Brunswick, as a member and Vice- Chairperson of the Local Governance Commission, effective April 4, 2024, for a term of three years. 2.0 Under paragraph 5(1)(b) and subsection. 5(3) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Troy Stone of Bath, New Brunswick, as a member of the Local Governance Commission, effective April 4, 2024, for a term of five years. 3. Under paragraph 5(1)(b) and subsection 5(3) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints John Nugent of Saint John, New Brunswick, as a member of the Local Governance Commission, effective April 4, 2024, for a term of five years. 4. Under paragraph 5(1})(b) and subsection 5{3) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Donna Redmond Gates of Quispamsis, New Brunswick, as a member of the Local Governance Commission, effective April 4, 2024, for a term of three years. -2- 82 5. Under section 8 of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council determines the remuneration for the Vice- Chairperson and members of the Local Governance Commission as follows: a) $200 for a day of four hours or more; b) $100 for a day of less than four hours; and c) $400 for a day when the Vice-Chairperson acts in absence of the Chairperson; or d) $200 for a day of less than four hours when the Vice-Chairperson acts in absence of the Chairperson. 6. Under section 8 of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council fixes the rate for reimbursement of expenses incurred by the Vice-Chairperson and members of the Local Governance Commission while acting on behalf of the Commission in accordance with Government of New Brunswick Administration Manual Policy AD-2801. Brenda L. name: Lynn Chaplin
body: 78 APRIL 4, 2024 2024-78 1. Under subsections 18(1) and 18(2) of the Police Act, and paragraph 21(1)(b) of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Brian Malone of Saint John, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Police Commission, designated as a part- time member, effective September 7, 2024, for a term of three years. 2. Under subsections 18(1) and 18(2) of the Police Act, and paragraph 21(1)(b) of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Lynn Chaplin of Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Police Commission, designated as a part- time member, effective October 7, 2024, for a term of one year. 3. Under subsections 18(1) and 18(2) of the Police Act, and paragraph 21(1)(b) of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Sandy Ward of Dieppe, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Police Commission, designated as a part-time member, effective September 7, 2024, for a term ending October 6, 2027. 4. Under subsections 18(1) and 18(2) of the Police Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Sandy Ward of Dieppe, New Brunswick, as Vice-Chairperson of the New Brunswick Police Commission, and designates her as a part-time member, effective October 7, 2024, for a term of three years. Brenda L. Murphy my Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the . ) de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 4 April 2024. name: Mario Comeau
body: 79 APRIL 4, 2024 2024-79 1. Under paragraphs 3(1)(b) and 3(2)(a) of the Forest Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Mario Comeau of Free Grant, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Forest Products Commission, representing producers, effective May 27, 2024, for a term of three years. 2. Under paragraphs 3(1)(c) and 3(2)(a) of the Forest Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Brent Thompson of Rothesay, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Forest Products Commission, representing forest industries of New Brunswick, effective April 4, 2024, for a term of three years. 3. Under paragraph 3(1)(d), and subsections 4(1) and 4(3) of the Forest Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Peter MacNutt of Richibucto Road, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Forest Products Commission, representing the Department of Natural Resources and Energy Development, effective April 4, 2024, for a term ending September 25, 2025. 4. Under paragraphs 3(1)(d) and 3(2)(b) of the Forest Products Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes section 2 of Order in Council 2022-172 dated June 23, 2022. Brenda L. ahaea) Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil / ) . Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 4 April 2024. Chasl t ts, Mn Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire du Cabinet

name: Natasha Ostaff
body: 81 APRIL 4, 2024 2024-81 1. Under subsection 8(5) of the Opportunities New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council acknowledges receipt ofa description of the skills and qualifications required of the Board of Directors of Opportunities New Brunswick as a whole in order for the Board of Directors of Opportunities New Brunswick to carry out its functions, and the skills and qualifications required of nominees for the Board positions to be filled. 2. Under paragraph 8(6)(c) of the Opportunities New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council acknowledges receipt of a description of the recruitment, assessment and selection processes and the results of those processes. 3. Under paragraph 8(1)(c) and subsections 8(3) and 9(1) of the Opportunities New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Natasha Ostaff of Moncton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Directors of Opportunities New Brunswick, effective April 4, 2024, for a term of three years. 4. Under paragraph 8(1)(c) and subsections 8(3) and 9(1) of the Opportunities New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Tom Liston of Toronto, Ontario, as a member of the Board of Directors of Opportunities New Brunswick, effective April 4, 2024, for a term of two years. 81 5. Under section 10 of the Opportunities New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Barry Kyle of Bathurst, New Brunswick, as Chairperson of the Board of Directors of Opportunities New Brunswick, effective April 4, 2024, for a term ending August 25, 2025. 6. Under section 10 of the Opportunities New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Andrew McLaughlin, New Brunswick, as Vice-Chairperson of the Board of Directors of Opportunities New Brunswick, effective April 4, 2024, for a term ending December 6, 2026. Av. pay Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the 7 de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 4 April 2024. name: Rino Volpé
body: 85 APRIL 10, 2024 2024-85 1. Under subsections 7(1) and 7(1.1) of the New Brunswick Health and Senior Care Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Rino Volpé of Saint-Jacques, New Brunswick, as a member and Chair of the New Brunswick Health and Senior Care Council, effective April 10, 2024, for a term of one year. 2. Under subsection 8(1) of the New Brunswick Health and Senior Care Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council determines the remuneration and fixes the rate for reimbursement of expenses for members of the New Brunswick Health and Senior Care Council, as follows: a) the Chair shall be remunerated in the amount of $20,000 per annum, and b) the Chair and members shall be remunerated in the amount of $500 per day, or $250 per half day, or part thereof while performing duties of the Council, and shall be reimbursed for travel and living expenses incurred in the performance of their duties in accordance with the Government of New Brunswick Travel Directive AD-2801. Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the . . de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 10 April 2024. name: Chantal Cormier
body: 92 APRIL 18, 2024 2024-92 1. Under subsection15(6) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council acknowledges receipt of a description of the skills and qualifications required of the Board of Directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation as a whole in order for the Board to carry out its functions, and the skills and qualification requirements for nominees for the Board of Directors positions to be filled. 2. Under paragraph 15(7)(c) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council acknowledges receipt of a description of the recruitment, assessment and selection processes used by the Board of Directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation in making nominations and the results of those processes. 3. Under paragraph 15(2)(b) and subsections 15(3) and 15(5) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Wayne Power of Rothesay, New Brunswick, as a Director of the Board of Directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, effective April 18, 2024, for a term of three years. 4. , Under paragraph 15(2)(b) and subsections 15(3) and 15(5) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Patrick Oland of Saint John, New Brunswick, as a Director of the Board of Directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, effective April 18, 2024, for a term of three years. 5. Under paragraph 15(2)(b) and subsection 15(8) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Chantal Cormier of Moncton, New Brunswick, as a Director of the Board of Directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, effective April 18, 2024, for a term of four years. 92 6. Under paragraph 15(2)(b) and subsection 15(8) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Paul McCoy of Western Springs, Illinois, United States of America, as a Director of the Board of Directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, effective April 18, 2024, for a term of four years. 7. Under paragraph 15(2)(b) and subsection 15(8) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Scott Northard of Hastings, Minnesota, United States of America, as a Director of the Board of Directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, effective April 18, 2024, for a term of three years. 8. Under paragraph 15(2)(b) and subsection 15(8) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Nancy Whipp of Shediac, New Brunswick, as a Director of the Board of Directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, effective April 18, 2024, for a term of one year. f) ry. name: Donald Cullinan
body: 101 APRIL 25, 2024 2024-101 1. Under subsection 7.5(1) of the Mental Health Act and subsections 8(1) and 8(4) of N.B. Regulation 94-33, the General Regulation under the Mental Health Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Donald Cullinan of Saint John, New Brunswick, as a Chair to the Mental Health Tribunals for Zones 1, 2, 3 and 7 (South), effective April 25, 2024, for a term of five years. 2. Under subsection 7.5(1) of the Mental Health Act and subsections 8(1) and 8(4) of N.B. Regulation 94-33, the General Regulation under the Mental Health Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Gary McLaughlin of Edmundston, New Brunswick, as a Chair to the Mental Health Tribunals for Zones 4, 5, and 6 (North), effective April 25, 2024, fora term of five years. 3. Under subsection 30(1) of the Mental Health Act and subsections 17.2(2) and 17.2(4) of N.B. Regulation 94-33, the General Regulation under the Mental Health Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Shelley Dumouchel of Fredericton, New Brunswick, as an alternate chair to the Mental Health Review Boards for Zones 1, 2, 3, and 7 (South), effective April 25, 2024, for a term of five years. 4. Under subsection 30(1) of the Mental Health Act and subsections 17.2(2) and 17.2(4) of N.B. Regulation 94-33, the General Regulation under the Mental Health Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Rina Arsenault of Moncton, New Brunswick, as a member to the Mental Health Review Boards for Zones 1, 2, 3 and 7 (South), effective April 25, 2024, for a term of five years. -2- 101 5. Under subsection 30(1) of the Mental Health Act and subsections 17.2(2) and 17.2(4) of N.B. Regulation 94-33, the General Regulation under the Mental Health Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Luc Blacquiere of Tetagouche, New Brunswick, as a member to the Mental Health Review Boards for Zone 4, 5, and 6 (North), effective April 25, 2024, for a term of five years. 6. Under subsection 30(1) of the Mental Health Act and subsections 17.2(2) and 17.2(4) of N.B. Regulation 94-33, the General Regulation under the Mental Health Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Lucie Robichaud of the Baie du Petit-Pokemouche, New Brunswick, as an alternate member to the Mental Health Review Boards for Zone 4, 5, and 6 (North), effective April 25, 2024, for a term of five years. 7. Under subsection 30(1) of the Mental Health Act and subsections 17.2(2) and 17.2(4) of N.B. Regulation 94-33, the General Regulation under the Mental Health Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Dr. Sergiy Ostashko of Miramichi, New Brunswick, as a psychiatrist member to the Mental Health Review Boards for Zones 4, 5 and 6 (North), effective April 25, 2024, for a term of five years. 8. Under subsection 7.5(1 ) of the Mental Health Act, subsections 8(3) and (4) of N.B. Regulation 94-33, the General Regulation under the Mental Health Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council revokes section 2 of Order in Council 2023-103 dated May 18, 2023, effective April 25, 2024. 9. Under subsection 30(1) of the Mental Health Act and subsections 17.2(2) and 17.2(4) of N.B. Regulation 94-33, the General Regulation under the Mental Health Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Monique Mallet-Boucher of Dieppe, New Brunswick, as an alternate member to the Mental Health Review Boards for Zones 1, 2, 3 and 7 (South), effective April 25, 2024, for a term of five years. 101 10. Under subsection 7.5(1) of the Mental Health Act, subsections 8(1) and (4) of N.B. Regulation 94-33, the General Regulation under the Mental Health Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council revokes section 1 of Order in Council 2023-224 dated November 2, 2023, effective April 25, 2024. name: Stephen Manuel
body: 111 MAY 2, 2024 2024-111 Under section 61 of the Control of Municipalities Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2024-32 dated February 15, 2024, effective May 15, 2024, and: a) The Municipality of Lakeland Ridges ceases to be subject to the provisions of Part V of the Control of Municipalities Act, and the supervisor appointed by Order in Council 2024-32 no longer exercises jurisdiction and control over the municipality; and b = Stephen Manuel, supervisor of the Municipality of Lakeland Ridges, ceases to have the authority to take full charge and control over all money belonging to the Municipality of Lakeland Ridges and received by any person for or on its behalf, and ceases to have the authority to sign all cheques drawn and issued by the municipality, and that any person previously authorized to countersign cheques ceases to have the authority to countersign cheques with Stephen Manuel as set out in Order in Council 2024-32. Brenda L. name: John P. Logan
body: 119 MAY 16, 2024 2024-119 1. Under subsection 4(5) of the Energy and Utilities Board Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council acknowledges receipt of the skills and qualifications required of the New Brunswick Energy and Utilities Board as a whole to carry out its functions, the skills and qualifications required of the candidates for the positions on the Board, and the Board’s comments and recommendations pertaining to candidates. 2. Under paragraph 4(4)(d) of the Energy and Utilities Board Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council acknowledges receipt of a description of the recruitment, assessment and selection processes used and the results of those processes. 3. Under paragraph 4(1)(b) and subsection 5(1) of the Energy and Utilities Board Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council appoints John P. Logan of Quispamsis, New Brunswick, as a part-time member of the New Brunswick Energy and Utilities Board, effective May 16, 2024, for a term of five years. 4. Under section 7 of the Energy and Utilities Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council determines the remuneration for part-time members of the New Brunswick Energy and Utilities Board be set in the amount of an annual stipend of $5000, and per diems of $500 for four hours or more and $250 for less than four hours. Under subsections 3(1) and 3(2) of the Kings Landing Corporation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Bradley Cross of Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a Director of the Kings Landing Corporation, effective June 6, 2024, for a term of three years. 2. Under subsections 3(1) and 3(2) of the Kings Landing Corporation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Tommy Dixon of Perth Andover, New Brunswick, as a Director of the Kings Landing Corporation, effective June 6, 2024, for a term of two years. 3. Under subsections 3(1) and 3(2) of the Kings Landing Corporation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Chantal Gauthier of Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a Director of the Kings Landing Corporation, effective June 6, 2024, for a term of three years. 4. Under subsections 3(1) and 3(2) of the Kings Landing Corporation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Susan Knight of Upper Kingsclear, New Brunswick, as a Director of the Kings Landing Corporation, effective June 6, 2024, for a term of one year. 5. Under subsections 3(1) and 3(2) of the Kings Landing Corporation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Cathy Pugh of Fredericton, ‘New Brunswick, as a Director of the Kings Landing Corporation, effective June 6, 2024, for a term of three years. 135 6. Under subsections 3(1) and 3(2) of the Kings Landing Corporation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Cynthia Robinson of Belledune, New Brunswick, as a Director of the Kings Landing Corporation, effective June 6, 2024, for.a term of three years. Ahr Brenda L. name: Melanie Patrick
position: Clerk of the Court of King's Bench of New Brunswick - Trial Division and Clerk of the Probate Court of New Brunswick
body: 137 JUNE 6, 2024 2024-137 1. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, and subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Anthony Coulombe of Campbellton, New Brunswick, as a Clerk of the Court of King's Bench of New Brunswick - Trial Division, Administrator of the Court of King's Bench of New Brunswick - Family Division and Clerk of the Probate Court of New Brunswick, for the Judicial District of Campbellton, effective June 6, 2024. 2. Under subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, and subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Stephanie Pelletier of Saint-Basile, New Brunswick, as a Clerokf the Court of King's Bench of New Brunswick - Trial Division, Administrator of the Court of King's Bench of New Brunswick - Family Division and Clerk of the Probate Court of New Brunswick, for the Judicial District of Edmundston, effective June 6, 2024. 3. Under subsection 68(1) of the Judicature Act, and subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Melanie Patrick of Hampton, New Brunswick, as Clerk of the Court of King's Bench of New Brunswick - Trial Division and Clerk of the Probate Court of New Brunswick, for the Judicial District-of Saint John, effective June 6, 2024. 137 4. Under subsection 68(1) of the Judicature Act, subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes section 1 of Order in Council 2024- 49 dated March 12, 2024. A Weps Brenda L. body: 154 JUNE 20, 2024 2024-154 1. Under subsections 20.1(1) and 20.1(3) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers' Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Alexandra LeBreton of Moncton, New Brunswick, as a Vice-Chairperson of the Workers' Compensation Appeals Tribunal, effective June 20, 2024, for a term of four years. 2. Under subsections 20.1(1) and 20.1(3) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers' Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Chelsea Seale of Saint John, New Brunswick, as a Vice-Chairperson of the Workers' Compensation Appeals Tribunal, effective June 20, 2024, for a term of four years. 3. Under subsections 20.1(1) and 20.1(3) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers' Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Meg Collins of Saint John, New Brunswick, as a Vice-Chairperson of the Workers' Compensation Appeals Tribunal, effective June 20, 2024, for a term of four years. /? name: Emily Muckler
body: 155 JUNE 20, 2024 2024-155 1. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsections 5(2) and 5(5) of the New Brunswick Women’s Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Regroupement féministe du Nouveau-Brunswick, as a member organization, represented by Geneviéve Latour of Rogersville, New Brunswick, to the New Brunswick Women’s Council, effective June 20, 2024, for a term of three years. 2. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsections 5(2) and 5(5) of the New Brunswick Women’s Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints YWCA Moncton, as a member organization, represented by Michéle. Nadeau of Shediac, New Brunswick, to the New Brunswick Women’s Council, effective June 20, 2024, for a term of three years. 3. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsections 5(2) and 5(5) of the New Brunswick Women’s Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Alter Acadie, as a member organization, represented by Emily Muckler of Moncton, New Brunswick, to the New Brunswick Women’s Council, effective June 20, 2024, for a term of three years. 4. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsections 5(2) and 5(5) of the New Brunswick Women’s Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints University of New Brunswick Nursing Faculty, as a member organization, represented by Patricia Morris of Fredericton, New Brunswick, to the New Brunswick Women’s Council, effective June 20, 2024, for a term of three years. -2- 155 5. Under paragraph 5(1}(c) and subsections 5(2) and 5(5) of the New Brunswick Women’s Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Tiffany Mirzica of Moncton, New Brunswick, as a member to the New Brunswick Women’s Council, effective June 20, 2024, for a term of three years. 6. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsections 5(2) and 5(5) of the New Brunswick Women’s Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Sexual Violence New Brunswick, as a member organization, represented by Jennifer Richard of Dieppe, New Brunswick, to the New Brunswick's Women’s Council, effective June 20, 2024, for a term of three years. Brenda L. arabs 0 Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the 20 June 2024. de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire du Cabinet

body: 153 JUNE 20, 2024 2024-153 Under paragraph 9(3)(e) and subsection 11(2) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Maderic Kadjo Atta of Shippagan, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Governors of the College communautaire du Nouveau- Brunswick, as a student member nominated by its students, effective July 1, 2024, for a term of one year. name: Meg Collins
body: 154 JUNE 20, 2024 2024-154 1. Under subsections 20.1(1) and 20.1(3) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers' Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Alexandra LeBreton of Moncton, New Brunswick, as a Vice-Chairperson of the Workers' Compensation Appeals Tribunal, effective June 20, 2024, for a term of four years. 2. Under subsections 20.1(1) and 20.1(3) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers' Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Chelsea Seale of Saint John, New Brunswick, as a Vice-Chairperson of the Workers' Compensation Appeals Tribunal, effective June 20, 2024, for a term of four years. 3. Under subsections 20.1(1) and 20.1(3) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers' Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Meg Collins of Saint John, New Brunswick, as a Vice-Chairperson of the Workers' Compensation Appeals Tribunal, effective June 20, 2024, for a term of four years. /? name: Michéle Nadeau
body: 155 JUNE 20, 2024 2024-155 1. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsections 5(2) and 5(5) of the New Brunswick Women’s Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Regroupement féministe du Nouveau-Brunswick, as a member organization, represented by Geneviéve Latour of Rogersville, New Brunswick, to the New Brunswick Women’s Council, effective June 20, 2024, for a term of three years. 2. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsections 5(2) and 5(5) of the New Brunswick Women’s Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints YWCA Moncton, as a member organization, represented by Michéle. Nadeau of Shediac, New Brunswick, to the New Brunswick Women’s Council, effective June 20, 2024, for a term of three years. 3. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsections 5(2) and 5(5) of the New Brunswick Women’s Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Alter Acadie, as a member organization, represented by Emily Muckler of Moncton, New Brunswick, to the New Brunswick Women’s Council, effective June 20, 2024, for a term of three years. 4. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsections 5(2) and 5(5) of the New Brunswick Women’s Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints University of New Brunswick Nursing Faculty, as a member organization, represented by Patricia Morris of Fredericton, New Brunswick, to the New Brunswick Women’s Council, effective June 20, 2024, for a term of three years. -2- 155 5. Under paragraph 5(1}(c) and subsections 5(2) and 5(5) of the New Brunswick Women’s Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Tiffany Mirzica of Moncton, New Brunswick, as a member to the New Brunswick Women’s Council, effective June 20, 2024, for a term of three years. 6. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsections 5(2) and 5(5) of the New Brunswick Women’s Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Sexual Violence New Brunswick, as a member organization, represented by Jennifer Richard of Dieppe, New Brunswick, to the New Brunswick's Women’s Council, effective June 20, 2024, for a term of three years. name: (Tracy) Denise Cassidy
body: 167 JUNE 27, 2024 2024-167 | Under subsections 58(3) and 60(3) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Brigette Ouellette of Grand-Sault, New Brunswick, as a Vice-Chair of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Tribunal, effective June 27, 2024, for a term of five years. 2. Under paragraph 58(1)(b) and subsection 60(3) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Monica Plourde of Edmundston, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Tribunal, from Region A, effective ‘June 27, 2024, for a term of three years. 3... _—-—-Under subsections 58(2) and 60(3) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Gary Mersereau of Fredericton Junction, New Brunswick, as an alternate member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Tribunal, from Region E, effective June 27, 2024, for a term of three years. 4. Under paragraph 58(1)(b) and subsection 60(2) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Paul G. Chiasson of Miramichi, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Tribunal, from Region B, effective June 27, 2024, for a term of three years. 5. Under paragraph 58(1)(b) and subsection 60(2) of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints (Tracy) Denise Cassidy of Norton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Tribunal, from Region D, effective July 10, 2024, for a term of three years. 167 6. Under section 61 of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council determines the remuneration for members and alternate members of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Tribunal as follows: a) $160 for a day of four hours or more; and b) $80 for a day of less than four hours. 7. Under section 61 of the Local Governance Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council fixes the rate for reimbursement of expenses incurred by the Vice-Chairs, members and alternate members of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Tribunal while acting on behalf of the Tribunal, in accordance with Government of New Brunswick Administration Manual Policy AD-2801. u K Brenda L. Murphy rd Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the Yunw o? de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 27 June 2024. - Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire du Cabinet

name: Aaron Blake Kennedy
body: 272 NOVEMBER 2, 2024 2024-272 Under section 2 of the Executive Council Act, the Lieutenant- Governor appoints under the Great Seal of the Province, from among the members of the Executive Council, the following Ministers who shall hold office during pleasure, effective November 2, 2024: (a) The Honourable Susan Catherine Holt, Premier and President of the Executive Council; (b) The Honourable René Michel Legacy, Minister of Finance and Treasury Board; (c) The Honourable Robert Gauvin, Minister of Public Safety; (d) The Honourable Pat Finnigan, Minister of Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries; (e) The Honourable Claire Johnson, Minister of Education and Early Childhood Development; (f) The Honourable Gilles LePage, Minister of Environment and Climate Change; (g) The Honourable Aaron Blake Kennedy, Minister of Local _ Government; (h) The Honourable John Michael Dornan, Minister of Health; -2- 272 (i) The Honourable Robert McKee, Minister of Justice who shall also be Attorney General; (j) The Honourable Keith Chiasson, Minister of Indigenous Affairs; (k) The Honourable Alyson Jean Townsend, Minister of Post- Secondary Education, Training and Labour; (I) The Honourable Cynthia Miles, Minister of Social Development; (m) The Honourable Isabelle Thériault, Minister of Tourism, Heritage and Culture; and (n) The Honourable Chuck Chiasson, Minister of Transportation and Infrastructure. Az Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 2 November 2024. Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire du Cabinet Bln,

name: Judge Paul Scovil
body: 282 NOVEMBER 21, 2024 2024-282 Under subsection 4.5(1) of the Provincial Court Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the Honourable Judge Paul Scovil of the Provincial Court of Nova Scotia to preside over the following matter: a) on or about May 21, 2024 at or near Miramichi, New Brunswick, Stein Mason Anderson did commit an assault on Provincial Court Judge Johanne-Marguerite Landry, thereby committing an offence, contrary to and in violation of paragraph 266(b) of the Criminal Code (Canada) and amendments thereto; b) on or about May 21, 2024 at or near Miramichi, New Brunswick, Stein Mason Anderson did, without lawful authority, engage in conduct, to wit: jumped and spat over the plexiglass divider towards the dais where Judge Johanne-Marguerite Landry was seated, with intent to provoke a state of fear in a justice system participant, namely Judge Johanne-Marguerite Landry in order to impede that person in the performance of her duties, thereby committing an indictable offence, contrary to section 423.1(3) of the Criminal Code (Canada) and amendments thereto; and 282 c) on or about May 21, 2024 at or near Miramichi, New Brunswick, Stein Mason Anderson did willfully damage the Judge’s robe, property of Provincial Court Judge Johanne-Marguerite Landry, the value of which did not exceed five thousand dollars, and thereby committing mischief, an indictable offence, contrary to section 430(4)(a) of the Criminal Code (Canada) and amendments thereto. Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the (Bee de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 21 November 2024.
